nl.fw.yapool.sql.datasource

Class SqlProxyPool

  • java.lang.Object
    • nl.fw.yapool.Pool<T>
      • nl.fw.yapool.BoundPool<T>
        • nl.fw.yapool.PrunedPool<Connection>
          • nl.fw.yapool.sql.SqlPool
            • nl.fw.yapool.sql.datasource.SqlProxyPool
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IPool<Connection>

    public class SqlProxyPool
extends SqlPool
    A SqlPool that hands out proxies for Connections (via ConnectionProxy instances). Proxied connections release themselves back into the pool when they are closed by the user.
    Author:
    Fred

    • Method Detail

      • acquire

        public Connection acquire(long acquireTimeOutMs,
                 long maxLeasedTimeMs)
        Description copied from class: PrunedPool
        Calls BoundPool.acquire(long) but also validates the returned resource. If validation fails, the resource is evicted from the pool and BoundPool.acquire(long) is called again, if there is any acquire-time left.
        Overrides:
        acquire in class PrunedPool<Connection>
        maxLeasedTimeMs - if 0, lease time never exprires.

      • destroy

        protected void destroy(Connection c)
        Description copied from class: BoundPool
        Calls the factory to destroy the resource and fires a destroy-event. Method is called when resource is removed from pool.
        Overrides:
        destroy in class PrunedPool<Connection>

      • getProxyConnection

        protected Connection getProxyConnection(Connection real)

      • getProxyCount

        public int getProxyCount()
        Returns the number of connection proxies in cache.
